The joint Board of Aldermen and Supervisors met yesterday afternoon and decided to refer the report of the Board of Estimate on the Budget for the ensuing year to a committee of seven, for report at the next meeting. It was also resolved to print 750 copies of the document for distribution among the people--500 in English, and the remainder in German.

Later returns of the French elections fully sustain our statement that the victory was one for M. THIERS rather than for the Republic. That out of 105 candidates selected, 86 should be ranked merely as personal adherents of the Executive, is a fact which need not surprise any one familiar with the pressure which the Administration in power almost inevitably exerts upon French constituencies.

The Lilliputian wedding of the gallant Gen. Tom Thumb and the lovely Miss WARREN, in which all New-York took great interest many years ago, will make a suitable historical contrast to the Brobdignagian nuptials recently celebrated in London. The high contracting parties are not unknown to fame.

The Eckfords won another victory yester- day on the Union Grounds, Brooklyn, their opponents on the occasion being the Forest City nine of Cleveland. The telegraph a week since reported the arrival at San Francisco, from Magdalena Bay, of nearly a hundred colonists, originally from New-York, very much dissatisfied with their experiences in their attempt at colonising Lower California. Yesterday afternoon Capt. MAHON and Detective DOYLE, of Jersey City, arrested the notorious thief GRENTHAUL and his "woman." I saw Prince ACHILLE MURAT sauntering along the Boulevards, yesterday, looking as pleasant as if his cousin of Chiselhurst were still lord and master. The Prince is over here on political business, and has been feeling the officers of the army, and more especially McMAHON, Duke of Magenta. The Prince tried to hide his impressions under a laughing exterior, but I could have told him McMAHON'S answer to the overtures of his quondam Emperor.

The Missouri River has a world-wide reputation for muddiness. Some power may, by a miraculous means, wash the River Rhine, but any such attempt upon the dirty-brown flood of the Missouri will be sure to result in ignominious failure. Has ever poet ventured to sing the praises of this turbid stream? His river god must be yellow-haired with a vengeance, and his complexion more saffron-like than a Chinaman afflicted with jaundice.

Telegraphic advices from the City of Mexica to June 30, confirm the probable election of JUAREZ, and his party will have a majority in Congress. Vice-President COLFAX, by special invitation, passed the Fourth of July in Valparaiso, Ind., this being his first absence from home since his return from Washington. He left South Bend at 5 o'clock Tuesday morning, and went by way of Chicago. Reaching Valparaiso, he was met by a large procession, and escorted to a stand in the Court-house-square, where the public services of the celebration of the day were conducted.

A novel thieving case came up before Judge VAN BUSSE, of College Point, Wednesday. JOHN REINDEL had a party arrested for stealing crockery and hardware enough to furnish a store. Litigation was commenced in the County Court yesterday morning, touching the legality of the recent charter election in the town of New-Lotts. The contestants claim that the polling place was not that appointed by law, and that votes were received both before and after the hours set apart for that purpose. The new Lunatic Asylum on Ward's Island, begun about a year ago, is nearly completed. The cost is $700,000, which goes to the account of Public Charities and Correction.
